EventType.description: This alarm is generated when the temperature Above Upper minor Threshold
This alarm is generated when the temperature sensor Above Upper Major Threshold
This alarm is generated when the temperature sensor detects that the air inlet temperature exceeds the major alarm threshold.
This alarm is generated when the system detects an overtemperature signal reported by the CPU. This alarm is cleared when the temperature is within the normal range.
This alarm is generated when the temperature of the board power supply exceeds the threshold or the power supply abnormal

This alarm is generated when a voltage drop is detected on the mainboard or powered off exceptionally or power off timeout or a PSU fault is detected or PSU output voltage is not within the normal range.
This alarm is generated when the power supply to the server is interrupted while the PSU is in place.
This alarm is generated when the power supply to the RH8100 V3 server is interrupted or the power supply voltage is not within the normal range.
This alarm is generated when the number of PSUs detected is less than the PSUs detected upon the first power-on of the server.
This alarm is generated when the specifed voltage detection point is lower than the undervoltage threshold

EventID.name: ibmc-Hard reset due to watchdog timeout

EventType.description: This alarm is generated when the watchdog timed out during a process (BIOS POST, OS Load, or SMS/OS displayed in the timer user field) and the timeout action is set to hard reset.

EventID.name: ibmc-System shutdown due to watchdog timeout when timeout action is set

EventType.description: This alarm is generated when the watchdog timed out during a process (BIOS POST, OS Load, or SMS/OS displayed in the timer user field) and the timeout action is set to power down.

EventID.name: ibmc-System power cycle due to watchdog timeout

EventType.description: This alarm is generated when the watchdog timed out during a process (BIOS POST, OS Load, or SMS/OS displayed in the timer user field) and the timeout action is set to power cycle.
This alarm is generated when the server fails to obtain data from a sensor.

EventID.name: ibmc-Subsystem electronic label status minor alarm

EventType.description: This alarm is generated when an asset information error is detected in the self-check during the BMC start process.
This alarm is generated when a hard disk or SD card is malfunctioning or faulty.
This alarm is generated when a hard disk or SD card is removed or faulty or when a RAID array is malfunctioning or fails.

The SD controller integrated on the server mainboard enables the two SD cards to be grouped as a RAID 1 array to improve SD card data security. This alarm is generated when the SD controller detects that the RAID rebuild failed.
This alarm is generated when the system detects an overtemperature signal reported by the CPU.
This alarm is generated when the hard disk reliability decreases.
This alarm is generated when the system failed to detect the specified fan module.
This alarm is generated when the system detects a fault of the specified fan.
This alarm is generated when the system detects an uncorrectable error on a DIMM of a memory board.
This alarm is generated when the system detects incorrect DIMM installation or a DIMM fault during the BIOS startup process.
This alarm is generated when the memory temperature exceeds the major alarm threshold.

This alarm is generated when: • The button cell battery on the mainboard is faulty or the battery voltage is low. • The BBU (iBBU or supercapacitor) of the RAID controller card is faulty or the BBU voltage is low.
This alarm is generated when the system detects an internal error on the BBU (iBBU or supercapacitor) of the RAID controller card.
This alarm is generated when the system detects a CPU internal error.
This alarm is generated when the CPU self-check fails during the system startup process.

EventID.name: ibmc-CPU configuration error detected during running of the service system

EventType.description: This alarm is generated when any of the critical configuration errors are detected on the CPU during the running of the service system
This alarm is generated when any of the exception critical error occurs on the CPU during the running of the service system.
This alarm is generated when the CPU error detection and correction (EDAC) fails. This alarm applies to RH5885 V3, RH5885H V3, and RH8100 V3 servers.
This alarm is generated when a connection error is detected

EventID.name: ibmc-System Error when BIOS Startup Process

EventType.description: This alarm is generated if any of the following is detected during the BIOS startup process: • No DIMM • The only DIMM in the server is faulty. • The only DIMM in the server is installed in an incorrect slot.

EventID.name: ibmc-PS2 or USB device major alarm

EventType.description: This alarm is generated when the PS2 or USB device is unavailable or faulty.
This alarm is generated when the BIOS fails to detect the display device.
This alarm is generated when different types of CPUs are detected in a server.
This alarm is generated when: • The CPU does not match the BIOS version • The CPU matches the BIOS version but fails to load the CPU microcode.
This alarm is generated when a hard disk backplane fault is detected.

EventID.name: ibmc-disk or NIC or LCD Fault Status

EventType.description: This alarm is generated when a RAID controller card fault is detected or a NIC fault is detected or the LCD self-check fails or the LCD communication is lost

EventID.name: ibmc-BIOS or PSU or fan or memory or 32K clock Fault Status

EventType.description: This alarm is generated when the system detects some faults in BIOS or PSU or fan or memory or 32K clock or pcie
This alarm is generated when the hard disk usage exceeds the alarm threshold.

EventID.name: ibmc-System Error When System To Restart Or Failed To Respond

EventType.description: This alarm is generated when the management software detects a fault that may cause the system to restart or fails to respond.
This alarm is generated when the system detects a PCIe card fault.
